result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward R Ortiz

records.addlTxt: 1:40 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edward R Ortiz not in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Edward R Ortiz.  Atty. Griffis notes the matter was set before the court back on 8/29/22 for plea and sentencing but his client failed to appear, and a capias was stayed until today's date.  Atty. Griffis advises he has not been in contact with his client since the last court date and has no explanation for his non-appearance today.  Based on defendant's non-appearance today, as well as back on 8/29/22, the Court will issue a capias and order bail be forfeited.

9:00 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Edward R Ortiz not in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Edward R Ortiz.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he spoke with his client on Friday but has not had any contact since then.  Atty. Griffis requests an adjournment for status in about 2 weeks and that the court stay the issuance of a capias until then.  State has no objection.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias and adjourn for status in about 2 weeks.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:21 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Edward R Ortiz in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he has discovery and an offer which includes upfront treatment.  Atty. Griffis requests a plea and sentencing date in about 90 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:20 AM Defendant Edward R Ortiz in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
